algorithm_technique: Use a hashmap to store path lengths at each depth, processing lines to calculate file path lengths.
problem_summary_simple: Find the longest absolute path to a file in a file system represented by a string.
problem_summary_technical: Processes file system structure line by line, using a hashmap to store cumulative path lengths at each directory depth to calculate file path lengths.
key_insights: The depth of a file/directory is determined by the number of tabs preceding it.
A hashmap (or array) can store the length of the path up to the current directory at each depth.
When a file (containing a '.') is encountered, its absolute path length is calculated by adding its length to the path length of its parent directory.
